verses.kjv: And he said also unto his disciples, There was a certain rich man, which had a steward; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods.
verses.web: He also said to his disciples, “There was a certain rich man who had a manager. An accusation was made to him that this man was wasting his possessions.
verses.ct: Jesus also told his disciples this story: "A wealthy man had a manager who was accused of squandering his master's wealth.

verses.kjv: And he called him, and said unto him, How is it that I hear this of thee? give an account of thy stewardship; for thou mayest be no longer steward.
verses.web: He called him, and said to him, ‘What is this that I hear about you? Give an accounting of your management, for you can no longer be manager.’
verses.ct: So the rich man called him in and said, 'What's this I'm hearing about you? Turn in your financial records, because you're fired.'

verses.kjv: Then the steward said within himself, What shall I do? for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship: I cannot dig; to beg I am ashamed.
verses.web: “The manager said within himself, ‘What will I do, seeing that my lord is taking away the management position from me? I don’t have strength to dig. I am ashamed to beg.
verses.ct: "The manager thought to himself, 'What am I going to do now? My master is taking my job away. I'm not strong enough for manual labor, and I'm too proud to beg.

verses.kjv: I am resolved what to do, that, when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.
verses.web: I know what I will do, so that when I am removed from management, they may receive me into their houses.’
verses.ct: I know what I'll do — I'll make sure people owe me favors, so that when I lose this job, they'll welcome me into their homes.'

verses.kjv: So he called every one of his lord’s debtors unto him, and said unto the first, How much owest thou unto my lord?
verses.web: Calling each one of his lord’s debtors to him, he said to the first, ‘How much do you owe to my lord?’
verses.ct: So he called in each person who owed his master money. He asked the first one, 'How much do you owe my master?'

verses.kjv: And he said, An hundred measures of oil. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and sit down quickly, and write fifty.
verses.web: He said, ‘A hundred batos of oil.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write fifty.’
verses.ct: The man answered, '100 measures of oil.' The manager told him, 'Here, take your bill, sit down right now, and change it to 50.'

verses.kjv: Then said he to another, And how much owest thou? And he said, An hundred measures of wheat. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and write fourscore.
verses.web: Then he said to another, ‘How much do you owe?’ He said, ‘A hundred cors of wheat.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write eighty.’
verses.ct: Then he asked another, 'And how much do you owe?' He said, '100 measures of wheat.' The manager told him, 'Take your bill and change it to 80.'

verses.kjv: And the lord commended the unjust steward, because he had done wisely: for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light.
verses.web: “His lord commended the dishonest manager because he had done wisely, for the children of this world are, in their own generation, wiser than the children of the light.
verses.ct: "The master actually praised the dishonest manager for being so shrewd. And here's the truth: people of this world are more clever in dealing with their own kind than the children of light are.

verses.kjv: And I say unto you, Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness; that, when ye fail, they may receive you into everlasting habitations.
verses.web: I tell you, make for yourselves friends by means of unrighteous mammon, so that when you fail, they may receive you into the eternal tents.
verses.ct: So I tell you, use worldly wealth to make friends for yourselves, so that when it's gone, they'll welcome you into eternal dwellings.

verses.kjv: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much: and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much.
verses.web: He who is faithful in a very little is faithful also in much. He who is dishonest in a very little is also dishonest in much.
verses.ct: Whoever is faithful with very little will also be faithful with a lot. And whoever is dishonest with very little will also be dishonest with a lot.

verses.kjv: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?
verses.web: If therefore you have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?
verses.ct: So if you haven't been faithful with worldly wealth, who is going to trust you with true riches?

verses.kjv: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man’s, who shall give you that which is your own?
verses.web: If you have not been faithful in that which is another’s, who will give you that which is your own?
verses.ct: And if you haven't been faithful with what belongs to someone else, who is going to give you something of your own?

verses.kjv: No servant can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
verses.web: No servant can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to one, and despise the other. You aren’t able to serve God and Mammon.”
verses.ct: No servant can serve two masters. Either he'll hate one and love the other, or he'll be devoted to one and look down on the other. You cannot serve both God and money."

verses.kjv: And the Pharisees also, who were covetous, heard all these things: and they derided him.
verses.web: The Pharisees, who were lovers of money, also heard all these things, and they scoffed at him.
verses.ct: The Pharisees, who loved money, heard all of this and mocked him.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Ye are they which justify yourselves before men; but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.
verses.web: He said to them, “You are those who justify yourselves in the sight of men, but God knows your hearts. For that which is exalted among men is an abomination in the sight of God.
verses.ct: Jesus said to them, "You make yourselves look righteous in front of people, but God knows your hearts. What people value most highly is an abomination to God.

verses.kjv: The law and the prophets were until John: since that time the kingdom of God is preached, and every man presseth into it.
verses.web: The law and the prophets were until John. From that time the Good News of God’s Kingdom is preached, and everyone is forcing his way into it.
verses.ct: The Law and the prophets carried authority until John came. Since then, the good news of God's kingdom is being proclaimed, and everyone is pressing hard to get into it.

verses.kjv: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass, than one tittle of the law to fail.
verses.web: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away, than for one tiny stroke of a pen in the law to fall.
verses.ct: But it would be easier for heaven and earth to disappear than for the smallest detail of the Law to lose its force.

verses.kjv: Whosoever putteth away his wife, and marrieth another, committeth adultery: and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery.
verses.web: Everyone who divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery. He who marries one who is divorced from a husband commits adultery.
verses.ct: Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery, and anyone who marries a divorced woman commits adultery.

verses.kjv: There was a certain rich man, which was clothed in purple and fine linen, and fared sumptuously every day:
verses.web: “Now there was a certain rich man, and he was clothed in purple and fine linen, living in luxury every day.
verses.ct: "There was a rich man who dressed in purple robes and the finest linen, living in luxury every single day.

verses.kjv: And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, which was laid at his gate, full of sores,
verses.web: A certain beggar, named Lazarus, was taken to his gate, full of sores,
verses.ct: At his gate lay a beggar named Lazarus, covered with sores.

verses.kjv: And desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man’s table: moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.
verses.web: and desiring to be fed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man’s table. Yes, even the dogs came and licked his sores.
verses.ct: Lazarus longed to eat even the scraps that fell from the rich man's table. To make matters worse, dogs would come and lick his sores.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that the beggar died, and was carried by the angels into Abraham’s bosom: the rich man also died, and was buried;
verses.web: The beggar died, and he was carried away by the angels to Abraham’s bosom. The rich man also died, and was buried.
verses.ct: Eventually the beggar died, and angels carried him to Abraham's side. The rich man also died and was buried.

verses.kjv: And in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.
verses.web: In Hades, he lifted up his eyes, being in torment, and saw Abraham far off, and Lazarus at his bosom.
verses.ct: In Hades, where he was in torment, the rich man looked up and saw Abraham far away, with Lazarus right beside him.

verses.kjv: And he cried and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue; for I am tormented in this flame.
verses.web: He cried and said, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue! For I am in anguish in this flame.’
verses.ct: He cried out, 'Father Abraham, have mercy on me! Send Lazarus to dip just the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, because I am in agony in this fire.'

verses.kjv: But Abraham said, Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things, and likewise Lazarus evil things: but now he is comforted, and thou art tormented.
verses.web: “But Abraham said, ‘Son, remember that you, in your lifetime, received your good things, and Lazarus, in the same way, bad things. But here he is now comforted, and you are in anguish.
verses.ct: "But Abraham replied, 'Son, remember that during your lifetime you had everything you wanted, while Lazarus had nothing but suffering. Now he is comforted here, and you are in agony.

verses.kjv: And beside all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed: so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot; neither can they pass to us, that would come from thence.
verses.web: Besides all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed, that those who want to pass from here to you are not able, and that no one may cross over from there to us.’
verses.ct: Beyond all that, a massive chasm has been set between us and you. No one who wants to cross from here to you can do it, and no one can cross from there to us.'

verses.kjv: Then he said, I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest send him to my father’s house:
verses.web: “He said, ‘I ask you therefore, father, that you would send him to my father’s house;
verses.ct: "The rich man said, 'Then I beg you, father, send Lazarus to my father's house.

verses.kjv: For I have five brethren; that he may testify unto them, lest they also come into this place of torment.
verses.web: for I have five brothers, that he may testify to them, so they won’t also come into this place of torment.’
verses.ct: I have 5 brothers. Let him warn them so they don't end up in this place of torment too.'

verses.kjv: Abraham saith unto him, They have Moses and the prophets; let them hear them.
verses.web: “But Abraham said to him, ‘They have Moses and the prophets. Let them listen to them.’
verses.ct: "But Abraham replied, 'They have Moses and the prophets. Let them listen to them.'

verses.kjv: And he said, Nay, father Abraham: but if one went unto them from the dead, they will repent.
verses.web: “He said, ‘No, father Abraham, but if one goes to them from the dead, they will repent.’
verses.ct: "'No, father Abraham,' he said, 'but if someone goes to them from the dead, they will repent.'

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded, though one rose from the dead.
verses.web: “He said to him, ‘If they don’t listen to Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded if one rises from the dead.’ ”
verses.ct: "Abraham told him, 'If they won't listen to Moses and the prophets, they won't be convinced even if someone rises from the dead.'"
